result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnee M Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC Records office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.        (Order faxed to RECC at 9:55 AM.  Hard copy also mailed 8/28/19)

Restitution summary

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives recommendation, makes sentencing statement.  Atty Gerbers gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 2 & 4.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 & 4. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay the DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Plea hearing scheduled for 7/17/15, 9:00.
by State

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 6/11/15.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense has not prepared Defendant for a plea today, wants to find out what this case will do to offer on other files. State advises of multiple cases in multiple counties, advises that new offer won't affect old offer. Defense needs time to speak with Defendant. Bond set. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
